entry.title: AI-Assisted Note Corrections for Project Billing
entry.content:
Relevant for SAP Cloud ERP 2508. 

Introducing GenAI features in Project Billing 

With the 2508 release of SAP Cloud ERP, we are excited to introduce new intelligent features in Project Billing (4E9) that will revolutionize the way you process your bills. These enhancements are designed to make billing more efficient and accurate, saving you valuable time and effort. 

The Role of Billing Specialists 

Billing Specialists play a crucial role in reviewing cost postings recorded by consultants working on customer projects and preparing the bill. This process involves verifying the correct net rate, deciding which cost postings to include in the billing cycle, and determining the amount to bill.  

Smart Notes 

One of the most time-consuming tasks in this process of bill preparation is manually reviewing the notes maintained by consultants in the hundreds of cost postings considered for billing. 

This is where the Smart Notes feature in Project Billing comes to your rescue. Smart Notes is an AI-assisted feature that proposes grammatically corrected notes for items of the Time & Expenses (T&E) billing method with notes. These proposed notes are not only grammatically correct but also free from spelling errors. 

The biggest advantage of Smart Notes is that you can get these note proposals with a single click of the Smart Notes button in the Prepare Billing screen of the Manage Project Billing app. We support up to 500 T&E items with notes for note proposals in a single click. 

Flexibility and Control 

Billing Specialists have the flexibility to decide which note proposals should be accepted and saved, and which ones should be updated before saving. This way, we leverage the capability of GenAI to make your billing preparation faster while ensuring that the final decision on what notes are saved rests with the Billing Specialist. 

The feature best works for notes in English language. But do let us know your feedback for note proposals for notes in other languages.  

The notes saved in the Manage Project Billing app are also propagated to the Billing Document itemized list. This means that the note proposals reviewed and saved by the Billing Specialists can be made available in the Billing Document shared with your customer. This ensures that the notes are clear, self-explanatory and professional, reducing the time to settle the bill due to unclear communication. 

Do check the documentation in the Help portal for more details on this feature  AI-Assisted Smart Notes for Project Billing

 

Prerequisites 

To activate the Smart Notes feature, the following prerequisites must be in place: 

  • SAP AI Units 
  • Joule Premium for Financial Management 

Activation Steps  

You can get the Smart Notes feature activated via SAP for Me by navigating to: 

  • Dashboard- Portfolio & Products 
  • Business AI 
  • Look for the feature ‚Äì Note Corrections for Project billing, in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition  
  • Request Activation  

Summary  

The Smart Notes feature in the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release is set to transform the billing process, making it more efficient and accurate. By leveraging GenAI, we ensure that your billing preparation is faster and the communication with your customers is clear and professional. 

We hope you find this new feature exciting and beneficial. Happy billing!

entry.title: Stop AI Model Disasters: The Application Owner's Guide to Bulletproof Deployments
entry.content:
Co-Author: Lukas P√§tz

So, you've deployed a fantastic application, leveraging the power of SAP‚Äòs Generative AI Hub (linked reference architecture)! That's a significant step towards building intelligent business processes.

As a quick reminder: SAP‚Äôs Generative AI Hub is part of the AI Foundation. SAP‚Äôs AI Foundation, similar to an operating system provides the means to build, extend, and run custom AI solutions and agents at scale. It includes the generative AI Hub in SAP AI Core, which is a rich set of AI capabilities (40+ frontier AI models, orchestration, SDKs, etc.), for productive purpose, running on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).

Your application runs on BTP, and LLM technology powers the intelligence behind it. But here's what you can't delegate: managing the LLM‚Äôs Lifecycle for your application.

 

Understanding Model Lifecycle: A Key Distinction

Before diving into the model lifecycle, let's clarify the different ways you can leverage AI models:

  • Your self-hosted Models: You bring your own models (e.g., fine-tuned open-source models, proprietary models) and deploy them. This is akin to a Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) offering, where you manage the model artifacts, their dependencies, and their whole lifecycle on your own.  This gives you maximum flexibility: you can select, customize, and optimize models to fit your exact needs, including full control over versioning and performance. However, with that freedom comes responsibility. You‚Äôre in charge of the full lifecycle ‚Äî from infrastructure and scaling to security, compliance, monitoring, costs and updates.
  • SAP Managed Models: This is comparable to a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) offering. The Generative AI Hub provides pre-integrated, managed access to various LLMs from leading providers (i.e Azure OpenAI GPT-5, Google Gemini 2.5 Pro, AWS Claude Sonnet 4, etc.). It's important to understand that you do not need to acquire separate licenses for these LLMs; SAP handles the commercial agreements and technical integration. Furthermore, SAP takes on the responsibility for data privacy and security or confidentiality standards, related to the LLMs consumed through the Generative AI Hub, significantly reducing your operational burden.

For the following we focus on the latter. LLMs, the powerful engines behind generative AI, are constantly evolving. Model providers release new versions, older versions might be retired, and factors like performance and cost can change, as indicated by the graphic below. This dynamic environment means that the specific LLM version your application relies on today might not be available tomorrow.

 

Why Does This Matter to You, the Application Owner?

Here's the reality: AI models get retired. Your application depends on them. Without a lifecycle management strategy, you're one model retirement away from downtime ‚Äîand missing out on better quality from newer models.

Moreover, different model versions may offer significantly better performance. A newer model might produce more accurate summaries which can directly impact your application's quality, user satisfaction, and business outcomes. Not updating could mean missing out on substantial improvements in capability, efficiency, or cost-effectiveness.

Your Role: Stay Informed, Be Prepared

Your primary responsibility regarding the model lifecycle is to:

  • Stay informed about the models supported by the SAP‚Äôs Generative AI Hub, including their versions, capabilities, cost, and most importantly, their retirement dates.
  • Have a plan for upgrading your application's model configuration when necessary.

Let's have a look on how you can fulfill these responsibilities using the tools and information available.

Staying Informed: Where to Find Model Information

SAP‚Äôs Generative AI Hub provides several ways to discover and understand the available LLMs:

  • SAP Notes:

    The central source of truth for supported models is SAP Note 3437766. This note provides comprehensive information, including the list of available models, supported versions, token conversion rates, rate limits, and retirement dates. Regularly checking this note is essential. You can access it via https://me.sap.com/notes/3437766. Crucially, you can subscribe to this SAP Note (indicated by the star icon) to receive automatic notifications via email about any changes, ensuring you're always up-to-date.

  • SAP AI Launchpad (UI):

    It's the natural place for an application owner to explore the Model Library and discover available models and their details. The Model Library also supports through comparison functionalities like the Leaderboard tab. Here you can see similar or better performing models.

  • Discovery API Endpoint:

    For programmatic access or detailed inspection, you can use the discovery API endpoint. By sending a GET request to the {{apiurl}}/v2/lm/scenarios/{scenarioid}/models endpoint, you can retrieve a list of all available models, their versions, capabilities, and retirement dates. This is a powerful tool for checking information dynamically. Find further information about that on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

By utilizing these resources, you can proactively identify when the model your application relies on is approaching its retirement date and plan your next steps.

Taking Action: Upgrading Your Model

When it's time to switch to a newer model version (preceded by tests/benchmarks), you have two main strategies, decided during the initial deployment configuration:

  • Auto Upgrade (modelVersion: latest):

    • How it works: When you create your generative AI configuration for a specific LLM, either through orchestration API or as a deployment, you can set the modelVersion parameter to latest. This will automatically use the most recent version of the specified model that is supported.
    • Pros: Less manual effort. As we support newer versions, your deployment will automatically shift, potentially giving you access to model improvements without intervention.
    • Cons: Less control. Your application might suddenly start using a new model version which, although intended to be compatible, could introduce subtle changes in behavior or performance that you haven't explicitly tested. This can be particularly problematic if your application relies on consistent LLM output behavior. Furthermore, it won't help in the situation of moving to different models (i.e. GPT-4.1 to GPT-5).

  • Manual Upgrade (Specify <modelVersion>):

    • How it works: When creating your orchestration configuration, you specify a particular modelVersion, like "2024-05-13". When this specific version is close to retirement, you will need to:
      1. Select a suitable newer model version based on your benchmarks using the SAP Note, Discovery API and/or UI.
      2. Via our harmonized API in orchestration, it is easy for you to change your configuration to a newer, specific model version.

        And only if you handle your custom defined endpoint:

      3. Patch upgrade your existing deployment to the configurationId you created newly.
    • Pros: Full control. You decide exactly which model version your application uses and when to make the change, allowing for thorough testing beforehand. This is especially important for production systems where behavioral changes in LLMs can have significant impacts.
    • Cons: More manual effort. You must actively monitor retirement dates and perform the upgrade steps yourself.

Choosing Your Strategy: Best Practices

The best strategy depends on your application's needs for stability versus automatically receiving updates.

For most production applications, especially those sensitive to potential behavioral changes in LLMs, specifying a fixed modelVersion (Manual Upgrade) has emerged as a best practice. While it requires more manual effort, it provides the necessary control and predictability. Most application owners prefer not to use the latest parameter due to the risk of unexpected behavior shifts with new LLM versions. By fixing the version, you safeguard against such changes and can plan updates proactively.

If stability and controlled changes are paramount, opt for Manual Upgrade by specifying a fixed modelVersion and plan for scheduled updates. This allows you to thoroughly test new model versions in a controlled environment before deploying them to production.

If minimizing operational overhead and automatically getting the latest model version is preferred for non-critical or exploratory applications, use Auto Upgrade with modelVersion: latest. However, remain aware that behavior might change with new versions and you need to change from model to model.

 

In Summary

As an application owner, understanding and managing the LLM model lifecycle is key to your application's longevity and reliability.

  • Regularly consult SAP Note 3437766 and/or the Discovery API (or the UI) to track model versions and retirement dates. Remember to subscribe to the SAP Note for automated updates.
  • Choose an appropriate upgrade strategy (latest for automatic updates or specifying a modelVersion for manual control) when setting up your configuration and deployment. For production scenarios, specifying a fixed modelVersion is generally recommended as a best practice.
  • If using manual upgrades, proactively change your configuration within orchestration and if custom deployment is used you need to patch/upgrade the current model version before it expires.

By staying informed and prepared, you can ensure your generative AI application continues to deliver value seamlessly, leveraging the latest innovations from the SAP‚Äôs Generative AI Hub.

We recommend keeping a close eye on the What's new section for upcoming release announcements and implementation guidance.

 

‚ÄÉ

entry.title: AI-Assisted Smart Notes in Manage Project Billing
entry.content:
Hello All,

I am writing this article to give some insights on generative AI assistance features embedded in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud products like Professional Services.

Overview

The Smart Notes feature in the Manage Project Billing app proposes grammatically correct notes for project billing request items that already have notes maintained. Billing specialists need to manually review the maintained notes in the Note field in the Prepare Billing page of the Manage Project Billing app. This process can be very time-consuming because of the high volume of postings.

What's New

With the introduction of the new Smart Notes feature, you can get grammatically correct note proposals for project billing request items. When you accept the proposed notes, the updated notes are available immediately, thereby making the process more efficient.

How to access the feature

To access the Smart Notes feature, your business user needs to have the following authorizations assigned in the business role by an Administrator:

  • Business catalog: Project Billing ‚Äî Smart Notes Feature (SAP_PS_BC_BILLG_AI_SNOTE_PC)

  • IAM app: Project Billing Request (Object Page) (F4456_SNOTE_TRAN)

  • To access this generative AI feature within SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, an additional entitlement and authorization may be required.

More information can be found here -->https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/ee9ee0ca4c3942068ea584d2f929b5b1/99bb1ef3b5ce46c08e64fcfdc6d3882f.html?state=TEST&version=2508.00

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Professional Services SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 

Thanks

Shubham

entry.title: First Experiences GenAI-driven extensibility assistant for Custom Fields and Custom Logic app
entry.content:
These are my first experiences with the extensibility assistant

Use within Custom Fields:


You can call the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields app start screen, and in the details screen of a single custom field.

Calling the extensibility assistant in the start screen:

Example Prompt :Create a Z field in the Journal Entry Item Level , Field Name : Reference1 and Field Description : Reference 1_HD , Data Type : Char/Text Field Length : 20 and Enable it for the RAP BO I_JOURNALENTRYTP

In the initial screen of the Custom Fields app on the button bar at the top right of the custom field list, you'll find a open assistant button. 

Enter the prompt it will preselect Business context

 After selecting the right context accept the proposal from SAP it will create the field and enable to edit for detail screen 

Calling the extensibility assistant in the details screen:

  • On the button bar at the bottom of the screen, you'll find the diamond button.

  • if you want to ask about a custom field displayed on the details screen, you can refer to it using expressions like ‚Äúthis field‚Äù. A common use case is seeking assistance to expose the field through an OData service, UI, CDS view, or SOAP API.

  • Once selected Press save and publish manually . As you see from the below the field is automatically extended in the SOAP API section based on the prompt .

 

Use within Custom Logic:

  • Start the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic app by clicking the Open Assistant button on the implementations table toolbar

 

  •  The extensibility assistant will show a list of BAdIs that fit your request or a message if no BAdIs were found. 

Select and create implementation . This will only help to find right BADIs not generation of the coding in the BADI üôÇ

entry.title: SAP User Experience in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Every successful business knows that an exceptional user experience is the crown jewel of their operations. Not only does it enhance efficiency and productivity, but it also fosters customer satisfaction, ultimately leading to sustained growth and success in the competitive market. 

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release introduces a range of innovative enhancements, tailored to refine user interactions and optimize business processes with the help of artificial intelligence. Let's dive into these user experience highlights that will make your business shine. 

TLDR? Check out this video made by my digital twin to get an overview of my highlights:

 


Joule for business 

Speaking of jewels, SAP‚Äôs very own AI co-pilot, Joule, introduces advanced intelligent assistance to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, allowing business users to engage with their systems using natural language for quicker and more impactful results. By integrating artificial intelligence within the system, Joule serves as a digital assistant, revolutionizing the way users navigate and utilize business applications. It eliminates technical obstacles by understanding user intent and providing contextually relevant outcomes through intuitive, conversational interactions. 


Joule for consultants 

Joule for consultants is specifically designed to speed up project delivery by offering instant access to a unique, expertly curated SAP knowledge base. This includes over 200,000 pages of documentation and content from SAP communities, helping consultants find answers quickly and saving up to 1.5 hours daily. It also features SAP-specific code intelligence, reducing code interpretation time by up to 40%. Overall, Joule can accelerate project timelines by up to 14%, cutting a typical 12-to-18-month project by 1.5 to 2.5 months. 

 

Joule for developers 

Joule for developers is integrated within the ABAP development tools to enhance productivity by aiding in faster code writing, testing, and delivery for ABAP Cloud. For environments like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, it reduces development time and effort, speeding up value realization. Key features include predictive code completion, a chat feature for natural language queries, code explanation, and support for generating and improving ABAP unit tests and test classes for CDS entities, ensuring reliable applications. 

Design updates for SAP Business Suite consistency 

Navigation has become more seamless than ever with a newly designed navigation menu that removes the extra click previously needed to reach My Home. Users can now effortlessly access their favorite apps and folders from anywhere within the platform, enhancing efficiency. Additionally, personalization through "All Spaces" further improves ease of use. The introduction of the new shell bar maximizes vertical space while prominently displaying the product name. This update needs to be activated using "/UI2/SHELL_BAR_TOGGLE." Please note that adjustments may be necessary for automated testing. The user menu has been overhauled for greater intuitiveness, featuring larger images, improved spacing, and an easily accessible sign-out button. Notifications have also been refined for better management, allowing users to sort by date or importance with clear categories such as "Today" and "Yesterday." Finally, visual enhancements in Search and Error handling bring a modern touch to the interface, providing users with a smoother and more guided experience. 

Recap feature on My Home 

Moving on to user-centric improvements, the Recap feature is all set to transform how business users stay updated with their My Home enhancements. With a focus on saving time, this intelligent feature highlights the changes since the user‚Äôs last login by comparing current data with the past 24 hours. It brings tasks needing attention right to the forefront, streamlining decision-making and increasing productivity by allowing users more time for strategic work. 

Manage News app on My Home 

Meanwhile, the Manage News app strikes at the heart of timely communication. It centralizes internal messages and key updates by enabling the creation and dissemination of news articles directly on My Home. Here, administrators can control visibility, categorization, and the targeted audience of news content, facilitating consistent and streamlined communication across teams. This leads to greater connectivity and informed decision-making within the workforce. 

 AI-assisted UX features

In my last blog post, I introduced some of our AI-assisted UX features, which aim to enhance user interactions by making them more intuitive and efficient through AI-driven capabilities. With the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, these AI-assisted UX features are now generally available! We structure them in base features and premium features: 

  • Base features:
    1. AI-assisted enterprise search (available through beta testing in 2502 release): Users can access business data efficiently via natural language queries, enhancing productivity and user experience. Enabling this search feature allows employees to dig through data with queries such as ‚ÄúShow me sales orders in overall status in process" or "Show me open sales orders that have a net value greater than 100 EUR‚Äù, offering seamless data discovery.


       
    2. AI-assisted easy filter (available through limited promotion in 2502 release): This feature elevates your user experience by allowing filters through natural language, reducing time spent on manual input. Users can enjoy intuitive interactions and explore complex filters with criteria such as currency or date range all supported by generative AI. Access to recent and favorite queries further optimizes user interactions. 


    3. AI-assisted smart summarization (also available through limited promotion in 2502 release): It simplifies data presentation through rich text summaries of object pages. This allows for better business data understanding and efficient sharing across productivity platforms, ensuring smooth collaboration between co-workers and customers. 

       

Kick start your AI journey as an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customer or partner by using the base AI-assisted features at no additional costs. The only required action from your side is the acceptance of SAP AI terms for base AI-assisted features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (by one S-user of your company). Afterwards, we will reach out to you with a confirmation of the activation and send over the required, minimal, ‚Äúlast mile configuration‚Äù on your side. 

  • Premium features:
    1. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for insights cards (available through beta testing in 2502 release): Personalizing your My Home receives a smart upgrade through generative AI, adding insights cards directly with a mere click. It supports various SAP Fiori applications, offering previews for data consistency ensuring quality. 

       

And, as we cannot get enough of our AI-assisted UX, we have some more features waiting for you in beta testing in this release as well! 

  • AI-assisted smart solutions for situations on My Home: This feature enhances task efficiency by intelligently adapting the interface for rapid situation resolution. Leveraging AI-driven insights directly from the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition homepage, users gain easy access to essential information and actionable steps. This innovation fosters a seamless user experience, reducing the time and effort required for decision-making.

      
  • AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications: You can leverage AI to efficiently incorporate applications through natural language instructions. It allows users to preview and select AI-recommended applications swiftly, significantly enhancing the setup process. This feature is particularly useful for new users, making their interaction with the platform smoother and more intuitive.


  • AI-assisted easy fill: This innovation revolutionizes form completion by using natural language input to automatically map text to appropriate fields, minimizing navigation time and errors. This results in improved accuracy and efficiency in data entry, as users can maintain focus and streamline processes without tedious form-checking. 


  • AI-assisted error explanation: This feature aids in understanding and solving errors within SAP Fiori applications by delivering AI-generated resolution suggestions embedded within the error messages. This facilitates quicker problem-solving and enhances user understanding, particularly for newer users needing guidance on error resolution. 

Our beta testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition offers early access to new features and innovations, allowing users to experience enhancements firsthand and give feedback to shape the final product. Participants play a key role in influencing development to ensure it meet practical business needs, creating a collaborative link between developers and users for continuous improvement. Want to be part of this journey? Sign up for the beta testing here: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#campaign/3910  

Collaborative ERP: To-Dos in Microsoft Teams 

Speaking of collaboration, the To-Dos functionality within Microsoft Teams gives users the ability to receive notifications of new tasks directly within their activity feed, enhancing responsiveness and efficiency. This integration facilitates seamless approval processes, allowing end-users to act on situations swiftly, whether it be within Microsoft Teams or directly through SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This aims to streamline workflows, support decision-making based on real-time data, and improve team connectivity by centralizing task management within familiar interfaces.

These enhancements in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 are designed not only to transform but also to ignite the user experience, bringing an elegant polish to the platform that goes beyond traditional bounds. 

Find out more about SAP User Experience in this blog series by Thomas Reiss. 

Want to learn more about Artificial Intelligence? Check out these blog posts by Yannick Peterschmitt and Sang Dao. Refer to this document for more information. 

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the replays of our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Early Release Series!‚ÄØ 

From July 21-25, we hosted a series of 21 compelling live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you. You will find the recording and presentation for SAP User Experience as well as 20 other topics of interest. Don't miss this chance and watch them on demand‚Äìanywhere, anytime.‚ÄØ 

üîéFind all our assets‚ÄØ 

We at Cloud ERP Product Success offer a service as versatile as our product itself. Check out the numerous offerings our team has created for you below:‚ÄØ

entry.title: Lead in the Age of AI, Start with Your Data
entry.content:
At a Glance: Lead in the Age of AI, Start with Your Data  

AI is only as powerful as the data it runs on. Inaccurate context, broken semantics, or outdated master data can turn automation from an advantage into a risk‚Äîcosting companies millions each year in delays, errors, and lost trust.  

SAP Business Data Cloud provides a trusted data foundation by preserving semantics, logic, and context of enterprise data. This eliminates manual data work, accelerates decision-making, and enables CFOs, COOs, and CIOs to act on accurate, contextual data.

Leading companies are already replacing manual workarounds with reusable data products, harmonized KPIs, and automated reconciliations.  SAP Business Data Cloud is launching a hands-on webinar series to help organizations unleash speed, trust, and impact with their data.

Learn more:Getting Started Series: Experience SAP Business Data Cloud

Full article: Lead in the Age of AI, Start with Your Data

Imagine an AI that automatically optimizes pricing to clear inventory while protecting margins‚Äîwithout human input. Now imagine that AI running on inaccurate data: the wrong currency, outdated master data, or misaligned cost centers. Suddenly, automation isn‚Äôt an advantage‚Äîit‚Äôs a risk. 

This is why data can no longer be treated as a back-office IT asset‚Äîit‚Äôs a strategic business capability. The companies leading in AI aren‚Äôt the ones with the most data, but the ones with the right data, at the right time, with the right context. 

When Poor Data Foundations Impact the Bottom Line  

According to Forrester, poor data quality costs organizations over $5 million annually. Even more alarming, 7% report losses of $25 million or more (Forrester, 2024). Gartner research reinforces this reality.  In a 2020 study, Gartner found that poor data quality costs organizations an average of $12.9 million annually (Gartner 2020).  

It‚Äôs rarely the volume of data that slows organizations down‚Äîit‚Äôs the lack of business context. Poorly managed master data, disconnected hierarchies, missing lineage, and duplicated logic all contribute to fragmented views that undermine trust, delay decisions, and increase cost. 

The typical workaround? Manual fixes: recreating data context, writing custom scripts, and rebuilding SAP‚Äôs logic in other tools. These solutions are often fragile, expensive, manual and error prone. When systems change or org structures realign, the fixes can break‚Äîand IT has a new project all over again. 

The result: every decision takes longer, and every delay carries a cost. 

The consequences are real: 

  • Product profitability becomes unreliable if cost and pricing data use different hierarchies 
  • Regional forecasting fails when customer hierarchies are inconsistent 
  • KPIs vary between teams because each is working with different assumptions 

The impact on business leaders: 

  • CFOs risk inaccurate forecasts, delayed closes, and loss in profits 
  • COOs waste time waiting on reconciling reports instead of driving execution 
  • CIOs / CDOs see mounting costs as teams duplicate work, rebuild logic, and rely on shadow systems 

Leading companies are changing course‚Äînot by rebuilding data outside SAP, but by activating the trusted business logic already in place. 

Unleash Speed, Trust, and Impact with SAP Business Data Cloud  

SAP Business Data Cloud helps organizations turn fragmented data into a trusted foundation for decision-making. By unifying data across systems and preserving the business context that gives it meaning it significantly reduces the need for manual reconciliation or reengineering.  

The result is now reversed because the data is accurate, and actionable, enabling faster execution, stronger alignment, and higher return on data investments. 

How SAP Business Data Cloud strengthens enterprise data foundations: 

  • Preserve context natively: context, semantics, logic, and hierarchies stay intact‚Äîno rework needed. 
  • Deliver trusted, reusable data products: Instead of manually preparing data for every model or report, teams can access governed, curated assets that reflect real business truth. 
  • Empower intelligent applications: With high-quality, harmonized data at their core, applications for planning, forecasting, sustainability, and operations drive insights where decisions happen real time‚Äînot after the fact. 

Customer Transformation in Action 
Discover how leading organizations are transforming their business with trusted data. Here‚Äôs a collection of customer testimonials showcasing how SAP helps companies tackle opportunities across industries‚Äîwhether through modernization, real-time decision-making, or unlocking new growth powered by SAP Business Data Cloud. 

SAP Featured Stories for Business Data Cloud 

Experience SAP Business Data Cloud First-Hand:
To experience the power of SAP Business Data Cloud, join a hands-on webinar series designed to accelerate data strategies. Across a series of interactive modules, here SAP‚Äôs product and leadership teams guide participants through practical steps to unlock business value from their data.  

Topics include:  

  • Build and simulate outcomes with Intelligent Applications 
  • Accelerate AI innovation with SAP Databricks 
  • Create analytical models and data products in SAP Datasphere

Learn directly from some of the industry experts on how to turn data into a true business driver.

Learn more: Getting Started Series: Experience SAP Business Data Cloud

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About the SAP Young Professionals Program
entry.content:
If you‚Äôre an ambitious graduate looking to launch your tech consulting career, the SAP Young Professionals program might be the opportunity you‚Äôve been waiting for! This free, immersive training experience opens doors to become an SAP Associate Consultant and kick-start your career among SAP's. 

What is the SAP Young Professionals program?

It is a free, 2-3 month intensive training initiative from the SAP Digital Skills Center that aims to equip recent university graduates (with less than 3 years of graduation) with SAP knowledge, soft skills, and certifications that prepare them for SAP consulting-related position within the EMEA region. 

Graduates are trained in SAP technologies such as: SAP S/4HANA , SAP Analytics Cloud ,  Artificial Intelligence , SAP Business Technology Platform , within others ((Modules may vary by cohort or region).

Who is eligible for the program?

Applicants typically need to meet the following criteria.

  • Hold a university degree (Bachelor‚Äôs or higher). 
  • Be a recent graduate (within the past 3 years).
  • Be currently unemployed or underemployed
  • Show strong English proficiency.
  • Be citizens or legal residents of the country where the program is being offered.

Note: Specific requirements may vary depending on country and region.

What does the program include?

Over the course of 2‚Äì3 months, participants will:

  • Earn globally recognized certifications 
  • Gain access to SAP Learning Hub and be trained by SAP specialists 
  • Develop soft skills
  • Have the possibility of starting your career as Associate Consultant in SAP's ecosystem (partners + customers)

Is the program really free?

Yes. The SAP Digital Skills Center delivers this program at no cost to participants as part of SAP‚Äôs mission to close the digital skills gap and support sustainable employment. SAP invests in rising talent to help drive digital transformation across industries.

Is employment guaranteed after completing the program?

While job placement is not guaranteed, one of the key goals of YPP is to connect graduates with SAP partners and customers who are actively hiring. Many graduates secure employment within the SAP ecosystem shortly after completing the program. However, success depends on the graduate's performance, certification results, and engagement throughout the course.

How to apply?

Applications are submitted via üëâ  SAP Digital Skills Center portal.

Keep an eye on the website or SAP‚Äôs social media channels for announcements about new program cohorts in your region.

Written by Valentina Guevara.

entry.title: End-to-End Business Transformation with SAP AI Tools: A Practical Example
entry.content:
About Me

Hare Krishna üôè I am an SAP BTP Cloud Architect sharing practical insights, solutions, and real-world experiences from the SAP ecosystem.

Introduction: Simplifying Grocery Business with AI ü•¶üõí

Grocery businesses handling food items and eatables want to deliver products faster, reduce mistakes, and delight customers. SAP offers a suite of AI tools that can automate, predict, and optimize business processes. In this example, we‚Äôll show how a large grocery chain can transform its Order-to-Cash (O2C) process‚Äîfrom receiving orders to delivering products and receiving payments‚Äîusing SAP AI tools.

Note: O2C is the flow where a customer places an order, the company delivers the product, and receives payment.

1. Organizing Data with SAP Datasphere üè¢üíæüìä

Objective: Combine data from sales, inventory, shipments, and suppliers into one view.

How it works:

  • Connect SAP systems and external sources (like supply chain partners and e-commerce platforms) üîó.

  • Transform raw data into business-friendly models for orders, deliveries, and payments üóÇÔ∏è.

Benefit for growth:
A grocery chain can reduce stock-outs and overstock üìâ, understand customer buying patterns üõçÔ∏è, and ensure timely deliveries üöö. With a single source of truth, managers make faster and more informed decisions üß†.

Analogy: Central nervous system ‚Äì integrates and harmonizes all data from multiple sources.

2. Managing AI Services with SAP AI Foundation ‚öôÔ∏èüõ†Ô∏èüìà

Objective: Provide infrastructure and services to deploy, monitor, and orchestrate AI models efficiently.

How it works:

  • SAP AI Foundation handles model orchestration, monitoring, logging, and deployment pipelines üñ•Ô∏è.

  • Works seamlessly with AI Core, ML DI tenants, and other AI services üîÑ.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can scale AI solutions reliably ‚ö°, ensuring smooth operations across multiple stores and warehouses üè¨ without disruptions. Managers can monitor model performance in real-time üïµÔ∏è, improving efficiency and reducing costs üí∞.

Analogy: AI control center ‚Äì orchestrates and monitors AI models and workflows.

3. Predicting Outcomes with SAP AI Core & ML DI Tenants ü§ñüì°üîÆ

Objective: Predict delivery delays, demand spikes, or payment issues.

How it works:

  • Build predictive models in SAP AI Core üß©.

  • Use ML DI tenants to access pre-trained AI models or train new ones using integrated data from SAP Datasphere üóÑÔ∏è.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can anticipate high-demand periods üìà, avoid perishable food wastage ü•¨‚ùå, and ensure timely replenishment üöõ. Predictive insights also help in identifying potential payment delays üí≥ or customer churn üîÑ, boosting revenue and trust.

Analogy: Predictive brain ‚Äì builds and deploys AI models for forecasting and insights.

4. Automating Tasks with SAP Build Process Automation üîÑü§ñüìù

Objective: Reduce manual work and speed up processes.

How it works:

  • Automate routine O2C tasks like approving orders ‚úÖ, sending invoices üßæ, and following up on payments üì¨.

  • Integrate AI predictions to trigger actions automatically ‚ö°.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can process orders faster ‚è±Ô∏è, minimize human errors ‚ùå, and focus staff on higher-value tasks üíº. Automation ensures smoother operations and higher customer satisfaction üòÉ.

Analogy: Workflow robot ‚Äì automates repetitive tasks and business processes.

5. Guiding Employees with SAP Joule üí°üìåüßë‚Äçüíº

Objective: Provide real-time insights and recommendations.

How it works:

  • SAP Joule offers suggestions, such as which deliveries might be delayed ‚è≥ or which customers need follow-up üìû.

  • Employees can take immediate, informed actions üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.

Benefit for growth:
Employees make smarter decisions faster ‚ö°, improving delivery efficiency üöö, customer loyalty ‚ù§Ô∏è, and operational agility üè¨. Real-time guidance reduces mistakes and accelerates response times ‚è±Ô∏è.

Analogy: Smart advisor ‚Äì gives insights in real-time.

6. Integrating Security & Identity with SAP BTP IAS/IPS üîíüõ°Ô∏èüîë

Objective: Secure AI and process automation tools while ensuring correct user access.

How it works:

  • IAS manages Single Sign-On (SSO) üîê for employees interacting with SAP AI tools.

  • IPS ensures only authorized users are provisioned into the system üë§.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain protects sensitive customer and supplier data üóÇÔ∏è, ensures compliance üìã, and safely enables access to AI tools across multiple locations üåê.

Analogy: Security gatekeeper ‚Äì ensures authorized access to AI tools & data.

7. Monitoring & Continuous Improvement with SAP Cloud ALM üìäüñ•Ô∏è‚ö°

Objective: Ensure the system works well and keeps improving.

How it works:

  • Track AI model performance and automated workflows using SAP Cloud ALM üìà.

  • Use feedback and metrics to refine AI models and automations üîÑ.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can continuously improve operations üè¨, adapt to market changes üîÑ, and maintain high customer satisfaction üòÉ. Monitoring helps spot inefficiencies before they affect operations ‚ö†Ô∏è.

Analogy: System monitor ‚Äì tracks performance & supports continuous improvement.

8. Enabling Real-Time Events with SAP Event Mesh üåê‚ö°

Objective: Ensure real-time communication between systems and trigger actions instantly across the O2C process.

How it works:

  • SAP Event Mesh enables event-driven messaging, connecting orders, inventory updates, delivery notifications, and payment confirmations.

  • Works seamlessly with SAP Build Process Automation and AI predictions to trigger automated workflows immediately.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can respond instantly to order changes, prevent stockouts, and ensure customers get accurate delivery updates üööüì≤. Real-time events also help coordinate multiple stores and warehouses efficiently üè¨, improving overall operational agility.

Analogy: Real-time traffic controller ‚Äì directs information instantly to where it‚Äôs needed, keeping the flow smooth.

9. Business Insights with SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) üìäüí°

Objective: Turn all collected data and AI predictions into actionable dashboards and reports.

How it works:

  • SAC connects to SAP Datasphere and AI Core models to provide interactive dashboards, forecasts, and KPI tracking.

  • Managers and executives can visualize order trends, inventory levels, and delivery performance in real-time.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can make data-driven strategic decisions, optimize promotions, plan inventory better, and track overall performance üìà. This strengthens customer satisfaction and profitability.

Analogy: Digital dashboard ‚Äì shows the full picture at a glance for informed decisions.

Industry Example / Use Case Snapshot ü•¨üì¶

Scenario: A grocery chain receives an online order for fresh produce, including perishable vegetables and fruits.

End-to-End Flow Using SAP Tools:

  1. Data Integration (SAP Datasphere üè¢üíæ)

    • The order details, inventory levels, and supplier availability are immediately centralized.

  2. Predictive Insights (SAP AI Core & ML DI ü§ñ)

    • AI predicts potential delivery delays due to traffic or stock shortages and estimates optimal delivery routes.

  3. Automation (SAP Build Process Automation üîÑü§ñ)

    • The system automatically confirms the order, checks stock, and triggers procurement if needed.

  4. Real-Time Events (SAP Event Mesh üåê‚ö°)

    • Updates on stock, delivery status, and payment confirmations are shared instantly across all systems.

  5. Employee Guidance (SAP Joule üí°üßë‚Äçüíº)

    • Warehouse staff receive recommendations on packing priorities for perishable items to minimize spoilage.

  6. Analytics & Reporting (SAC üìäüí°)

    • Managers monitor order fulfillment KPIs, customer satisfaction, and stock movement in dashboards.

  7. Monitoring & Continuous Improvement (Cloud ALM üìä‚ö°)

    • Performance metrics from this order feed into ongoing AI model tuning and process optimization.

Outcome:

  • The perishable order is delivered fresh, on time, and with minimal wastage.

  • Employees work efficiently guided by AI insights.

  • Managers gain actionable insights, helping the grocery chain increase customer satisfaction and reduce losses.

Key Takeaways ‚úÖ

  • Streamlined Operations üè¢ü§ñ: SAP tools optimize the entire Order-to-Cash workflow.

  • Smart Decisions üí°üìä: AI predictions and dashboards support faster, data-driven choices.

  • Automation & Real-Time ‚ö°üîÑ: Workflows run instantly with minimal manual effort.

  • Guided Workforce üßë‚Äçüíºüí°: Employees get actionable insights in real time.

  • Secure & Monitored üîíüìä: Access is controlled and performance continuously tracked.

  • Customer Satisfaction üöö‚ù§Ô∏è: Faster fulfillment, fewer errors, and smarter operations boost growth.

Ask & Learn ü§î

Q1: What is Order-to-Cash (O2C)?
It‚Äôs the process of taking a customer order, delivering the product, and receiving payment.

Q2: Do I need technical skills to use these SAP AI tools?
No. Tools like SAP Joule and SAC provide simple insights and dashboards that non-technical employees can use.

Q3: How does SAP Event Mesh help in this workflow?
Event Mesh enables real-time messaging between systems, triggering automated workflows instantly for faster operations.

Q4: Can automation replace employees?
Automation handles repetitive tasks, allowing employees to focus on higher-value work and make smarter decisions with AI guidance.

Q5: How does SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) add value?
SAC converts data and AI predictions into dashboards and KPIs, enabling strategic and operational decisions.

Q6: How is data security ensured?
SAP BTP IAS/IPS manages user authentication and provisioning, ensuring only authorized access to AI tools and sensitive data.

Q7: How do I measure improvement?
SAP Cloud ALM tracks system performance, AI model effectiveness, and workflow efficiency for continuous improvement.

entry.title: No More Guesswork: Joule‚Äôs Help Content Makes SAP Fieldglass Easy to Use
entry.content:
Joule for SAP Fieldglass is a productivity accelerator embedded directly into your SAP Fieldglass experience. Joule uses natural language processing to help users complete tasks, retrieve documentation, and make decisions faster‚Äîall without leaving the application.

Whether you're creating job postings or navigating other tasks, Joule delivers smart, contextual guidance. It‚Äôs like having a support expert built right in.

Use Case: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going out on vacation‚Äîhow do I assign a proxy?‚Äù

This is a common need in SAP Fieldglass ensuring continuity for tasks while away.  Instead of digging through manuals users can ask Joule:

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going out on vacation‚Äîhow do I assign a proxy?‚Äù

Joule delivers the relevant help documentation from the SAP Help Portal, complete with step-by-step instructions. This access to help content empowers users to self-serve confidently‚Äîboosting adoption and user experience.

With Joule, SAP Fieldglass becomes intuitive, responsive, and user-friendly. 

Next steps

1) To see more uses cases see the help documentation here - https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_Fieldglass/76e97fe0cccf4d37a5dadc652a375e33/e3dc12e0215447cfa4507eff66e8224b.html?q=joule+for+fieldglass&locale=en-US&version=LATEST

2) Register for the upcoming webinar entitled AI in SAP Fieldglass ‚Äì Current Capabilities & Innovations:  https://event.on24.com/wcc/r/5044009/B1F114D7F58F199C9B327A0AF0C678ED/5192177?mr=s
or catch the replay: https://event.on24.com/eventRegistration/EventLobbyServlet?target=reg20.jsp&eventid=4435612&sessionid=1&key=A3DE53CEDE437303128D05B9BAC0AFFA&groupId=6091913&sourcepage=register 

3) Reach out to your Customer Success Manager for more information.

entry.title: Process-Aware Agentic Testing of SAP with Int4 Suite
entry.content:
Process-Aware Agentic Testing of SAP with Int4 Suite

Let‚Äôs start with a simple example every SAP consultant knows:

Test Case: Create Standard Sales Order (VA01)

Step 1: Enter transaction code VA01 in the command box.
Expected Result: ‚ÄúCreate Sales Order‚Äù initial screen is displayed.

Step 2: On the initial screen, enter details like:

  • Order Type: <ip_Order_Type>
  • Sales Organization: <ip_Sales_Org>
  • Distribution Channel: <ip_distr_channel>
  • Division: <ip_division>

Step 3: Click Enter.

Step 4: Enter header details such as:

  • PO Number: <ip_PO_number>
  • Sold-to Party: <ip_sold_to_party>
  • Ship-to Party: <ip_ship_to_party>
  • PO Date: <ip_PO_date>

Step 5: Enter item details:

  • Material: <ip_Material>
  • Order Quantity: <ip_Order_qty>
  • Plant: <ip_plant>

Step 6: Click Save.
Expected Result: ‚ÄúStandard Order XXXXXX has been saved.‚Äù

Looks perfect on paper. But in real life, there are two big problems:

  1. Where to get the correct data to start the test? A VA01 script needs valid values for customer, material, plant, and so on. Guesswork doesn‚Äôt work. The best source is historical data already posted on production by one of the integrations. Int4 Suite can use millions of these API transactions as the foundation for realistic tests.

  1. What if the required master or stock data is missing in test? Even with a historical sales order in hand, posting might fail because the material never existed in the test system, the customer master is missing, or there‚Äôs no stock. This is where Int4 Suite acts agentically: it can copy the missing material from production, create stock via another API, and retry posting automatically.

This is the heart of Process-Aware Agentic Testing. Process-aware, because the software knows what data and conditions are needed for the test. Agentic, because it acts on its own to prepare that business context and complete the transaction.

And this problem is not limited to VA01. In many SAP projects, test automation still works in a very ‚Äúdry‚Äù way. A tool calls a transaction with some example data and checks the response. Technically it works, but it‚Äôs not how real business runs. It‚Äôs like testing a car engine without fuel in the tank, without air in the tires, and without a driver inside. The engine starts, but you can‚Äôt really drive anywhere.

Dry testing always brings the same frustrations:

  • Functinal consultants must provide ‚Äúreference data‚Äù,
  • missing objects must be prepared manually ‚Äì by functional consultants,
  • results are very hard to repeat.

Int4 Suite changes this. With access to millions of historical API transactions and the ability to prepare business objects through SAP S/4HANA APIs, it makes every test run in full business context.

  • Example 1: Posting a historical sales order fails because the material is missing. Int4 Suite copies the material from production, creates stock, and retries the posting.
  • Example 2: Testing a delivery fails because the sales order doesn‚Äôt exist in test. Int4 Suite can post a new sales order via API based on historical data, and then create the delivery.

For SAP S/4HANA projects, this is a new paradigm. Instead of brittle scripts and endless manual setup, you get agentic, process-aware testing: tests that adapt, prepare their own data, and validate full business processes end-to-end.

In short: don‚Äôt just test if a transaction runs. Test if it runs with the right business context. That‚Äôs the future of SAP testing with Int4 Suite.

entry.title: Realizing AI‚Äôs Potential in and Through SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Realizing AI‚Äôs Potential in and Through SAP Integration Suite 

AI is reshaping how enterprises approach integration, simplifying complex processes, reducing manual effort, and unlocking new levels of agility. In SAP Integration Suite, AI is more than just a trend: it is both a set of powerful capabilities enhancing integration today, and a key enabler for intelligent, connected systems in the future.  

  • AI in Integration Suite ‚Äì Intelligence is embedded directly into the product to enhance developer productivity, improve operational efficiency, and accelerate time to cloud through features like flow generation and optimization, anomaly detection, and intelligent troubleshooting and monitoring. 
  • Integration Suite for AI ‚Äì SAP Integration Suite also plays a vital role in enabling next-generation AI scenarios. It acts as the integration foundation for orchestrating autonomous, context-aware agents and supporting seamless interaction between AI systems and enterprise landscapes, backed by the governance and scalability that modern businesses need. 

This blog offers a practical overview of SAP Integration Suite‚Äôs evolving AI capabilities, highlighting how AI is embedded in SAP Integration Suite today, how it maps to key integration needs, and how it enables customers to build toward an AI-augmented future. 

 

AI in Integration Suite: Embedded Intelligence in Action

AI is not an isolated feature in SAP Integration Suite, instead, it‚Äôs woven into the platform to enhance how integrations are designed, built, and operated. Our embedded AI capabilities focus on delivering real, day-to-day value across two core dimensions: 

  • Improve developer productivity
  • Enhance operational excellence

Here‚Äôs how embedded intelligence is making an impact in these areas: 

Improve Developer Productivity 

Designing integrations can be time-consuming, especially when dealing with complex mappings, unfamiliar systems, or writing custom scripts to handle specific logic. SAP Integration Suite embeds AI to streamline this process and help developers move faster with greater confidence. 

  • iFlow Creation
    Developers can now generate integration flows simply by describing the scenario in natural language. This generative AI capability interprets the intent, assembles a draft iFlow with relevant flow steps, and gives developers a strong starting point, and significantly accelerating the design phase. Future enhancements are expected to include automatic generation of mappings, scripts, and other artifacts to further streamline the process. Check the roadmap for new updates. 

 

  • Script Optimization
    Generative AI in SAP Integration Suite can help developers refine Groovy and JavaScript scripts by analyzing code in real time and suggesting best-practice optimizations. These recommendations reduce the need for manual tuning, streamline the coding process and help maintain high performance and quality from the outset.
  • Integration Advisor
    Integration Suite is one of the first iPaaS to embed AI into capabilities for supporting B2B scenarios. Integration Advisor uses a machine learning-based, global knowledge pool to propose mappings between source and target structures. By learning from industry standards and past implementations, it dramatically reduces the time and effort required to configure B2B and A2A integrations, especially in complex message transformation scenarios.
  • Flow Step Recommendations
    When developers build integration flows, AI recommends the next logical flow step, such as a Groovy script or End Message, based on usage patterns. This intelligent guidance accelerates the flow creation process, minimizes trial-and-error, and supports consistent design quality across teams.

Together, these capabilities significantly reduce repetitive tasks, speed up development, and help teams deliver high-quality integrations more efficiently, regardless of their experience level. 

 

Enhance Operational Excellence 

Operational reliability is critical for scalable, enterprise-grade integration. SAP Integration Suite embeds AI to help teams proactively monitor, maintain, and optimize their integration landscapes, reducing manual troubleshooting and improving long-term performance. 

  • API Anomaly Detection 
    Leveraging machine learning, the platform continuously monitors integration flows and APIs to detect unusual patterns, such as latency spikes, increased error rates, or unexpected traffic surges. This helps teams identify and address issues before they impact business processes, improving response time and reducing downtime. 

 

  • API Volume Prediction
    AI models analyze historical usage patterns to forecast, providing two distinct insights: one on historical usage trends and the other on predicted future volumes. The dual view helps developers and operations teams stay ahead of peak loads and avoid capacity-related disruptions, ensuring both long-term planning and real-time operational awareness.
  • Script Optimization
    Generative AI analyzes custom Groovy or JavaScript scripts used in integration flows, identifying potential performance bottlenecks or inefficiencies. It then recommends optimized versions of the code, enabling developers to improve execution quality without deep manual debugging or rewriting.

By embedding these intelligent capabilities, SAP Integration Suite supports a more proactive, data-driven approach to integration operations, allowing teams to deliver higher reliability with less overhead. 

 

Integration Suite for AI: Enabling the Next Generation of Intelligent Automation

As the enterprise landscape evolves, agentic AI is emerging as a new class of autonomous systems that can reason, interact, and execute tasks on behalf of users. This shift is driving demand for more adaptable and intelligent integration backbones. To function effectively, these AI agents must be able to connect with enterprise systems, orchestrate business logic, access data, and execute workflows securely and reliably. This is where SAP Integration Suite becomes essential. It not only embeds AI to optimize development and operations, but also plays a foundational role in enabling agentic AI by providing the connective fabric that links intelligent agents with business applications and services. 

Across the industry, we‚Äôre seeing a growing push toward agent-centric automation, from AI copilots to autonomous digital workers, and integration is the linchpin that determines whether these agents can truly act in context. SAP Integration Suite helps enterprises bridge this gap with built-in capabilities that simplify how AI agents discover, consume, and govern enterprise integrations. 

Here are two ways it already supports this shift: 

  • AI Adapter
    The AI Adapter enables seamless communication between SAP Integration Suite and generative AI services, provided by SAP‚Äôs AI Core or third-party providers like OpenAI. With minimal configuration, developers can embed AI capabilities, such as text generation, summarization, or classification, directly into integration flows. This makes it easier to enrich payloads with contextual insights, automate decision logic, and integrate AI-driven functionality within a governed framework. By removing the need for custom scripting or API handling, the AI Adapter boosts developer efficiency and expands the scope for advanced AI-powered use cases. 
  • AI-Powered Content Recommendations in Business Accelerator Hub
    To help agents and developers access the right integration assets quickly, the SAP Business Accelerator Hub features Joule for natural language search. Instead of browsing manually, users (or agents in the future) can ask questions like ‚ÄúHow do I connect SAP S/4HANA to Salesforce?‚Äù and receive tailored recommendations across integration flows, APIs, and templates. This AI-driven discovery process reduces time to integration and enhances reusability, which is the key requirement for agent-based automation where responsiveness and adaptability are critical.

 

Where We‚Äôre Heading 

The evolution of AI in SAP Integration Suite is accelerating, expanding beyond foundational productivity and monitoring features into more adaptive, intelligent, and autonomous integration experiences. 

On the embedded AI front, we‚Äôre advancing how integrations are designed, optimized, and managed. Expect more powerful capabilities for automating integration development and API operations, along with intelligent migration from legacy systems like SAP Process Orchestration. These innovations are designed to further boost developer efficiency, reduce operational overhead, and reduce time to cloud. 

At the same time, SAP Integration Suite is evolving to support agent-driven automation. As part of this direction, we plan to enhance the API Management to allow AI systems to interact with enterprise tools and data. This will enable more dynamic, context-aware automation, built on a foundation of governance, scalability and future readiness. 

In the upcoming blogs, we‚Äôll explore each of the two directions in depth, highlighting real-world use cases, customer stories, and innovations that are redefining integration in the era of AI.

entry.title: Release Navigator for SAP BTP - What's New in Q3 2025
entry.content:

With the Q3 2025 update, we ensured all content is up-to-date and we are excited to announce the addition of a new product page for SAP Customer Data Solutions as well as some cosmetic UI updates. Read more about the details in this blog post.

After that, only the page within the Release Navigator for SAP BTP will remain available.

Check it out.

 

 

With this last round of updates, we added new visual elements to all release navigators. The UI updates in the Release Navigator for SAP BTP do not affect functionality or performance and are strictly cosmetical.

On the home page also known as the Product Specific page, you will notice that our Welcome and Release Calendar cards have received a facelift for a fresher look and feel. 

On all pages where you can open informational text boxes by hovering over the lightbulb icon, you will see a slight update to the design of these boxes. Content and functionality remain the same. 

As a reminder: These pop-up boxes show up on every page with a lightbulb icon at the top and may be moved around on the page or closed once you are done reading them.

 

 

For centralized information regarding the release of new features for SAP BTP products and services, consult the Consolidated Release Schedule for SAP BTP.

Regarding the Release Navigator updates, refer to this update plan:

*Disclaimer: The schedule is subject to alterations without notice, including potential delays or the integration of changes in subsequent update windows. It doesn't establish a commitment, promise, or legal duty to deliver any material, code, or functionality. Looking into the remaining quarters of 2025, updates will focus on quarterly content maintenance and a steady extension of product coverage. No substantial UI updates are planned for the time being.

 

 

The Readiness@Scale team within SAP Enterprise Support is driven to ensure release readiness across the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio. Our mission is to empower SAP customers to effectively adopt and utilize innovations.

If you have feedback or specific requests for content within the release navigator, feel free to contact us.

Don't forget to explore our team‚Äôs blogs tagged under Readiness@Scale.

Happy navigating!

Readiness@Scale  
SAP Enterprise Support

entry.title: Introducing the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt üî®ü™ô ... COMING SOON
entry.content:
Welcome to the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt, a chase around important SAP developer-related tools/sites, a challenge to construct a secret phrase, and a chance to win 1000s of points toward the Devtoberfest grand prize.

The hunt officially starts Sept. 25, with the release of the first clue during that day's SAP Developer News, and you have until the end of Devtoberfest, Oct. 24, to complete it.

To get all the clues make sure to SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

Learn more about the  entire Devtoberfest event in @KevinR's post Devtoberfest 2025 Welcome!.

What you need to find

We have hidden a special phrase, which you need to figure out using the clues in the next section. Along your journey you will do the following:

  1. Visit about 10 different locations related to SAP developers, mostly web sites that are designed to help you in your daily SAP development.
  2. At each location, you will discover a set of hexadecimal digits.
  3. Concatenate the digits together (in the order of the missions) to get one, 37-digit hexadecimal number.
  4. Multiply that hexadecimal number by another secret number, for which we will give a clue.
  5. Take the resulting 38-digit hexadecimal product, and convert it into the secret phrase, using each pair of digits as ASCII characters.
  6. Enter the phrase, exactly (case-sensitive, no extra spaces), into the Scavenger Hunt tutorial.‚Äå

Not until the SAP Developer News of Oct. 16 will you have all the pieces to be able to complete the phrase. 

Example Mission

As an example of what you will have to do, here's a short sample mission (just a warm-up, no points will be earned).

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
17

SAP Developers YouTube Channel

Go to our SAP Developer YouTube channel. 

Open @Rekha_DR's video "SAP Build Process Automation (Part 1): Build your very first process". Watch it and find the secret 7-digit hexadecimal number in one of the info cards.

26SAP Community

Use the Developer Tools on your browser to inspect the words "SAP Community" in the previous column and find the 6-digit ASCII code for the color of the text.

 

3None (directly) 

Concatenate the 2 sets of hexadecimal digits, in order, and multiply the resulting hexadecimal number by the number of original SAP founders (you can easily find the number on the SAP Wikipedia page).

Convert the resulting hexadecimal number into a phrase, converting each pair of digits into a character using ASCII codes.

üëâPost a comment/picture about the phrase -- but NOT the phrase itself  (like your experiences with or opinion about the phrase, or a picture of something belonging to you that reminds you of the phrase) -- you won't get any points, but it will be fun and you will be ready for the real scavenger hunt. If you have any trouble with this example mission, post in the comments.

REMINDER: The above is just an example of how the real scavenger hunt will work. The real scavenger hunt instructions will be described in the rest of this blog post, as clues become available.

 

The (real) mission

Below are the instructions for finding the hexadecimal digits for the actual scavenger hunt. We will release clues as follows:

  • In the SAP Developer News of Sept. 25, Oct. 2, Oct. 9, and Oct. 16.
  • In this blog each Monday during the first 3 weeks of Devtoberfest.

üëâTo be notified when a new clue is released, SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

‚Äå When you find the secret phase, just enter it into this Devtoberfest tutorial.

To guide you, we have created a second tutorial -- you do not have to use it, nor do you get any points from it. But you can enter the 1 to 6 digits from each mission to check if you received the correct digits for that mission.

Here are your missions:

 

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
12

SAP Developer News

The Developer News comes out each Thursday with the latest about ABAP, CAP, BTP, SAP Build, UI5, Fiori, AI, and all your favorite SAP developer topics. All delivered by some of your favorite Developer Advocates, like DJ, Shilpa Shankar, Thomas Jung, Antonio Maradiaga, Nora von Thenen and the rest of the gang.

Most episodes about 5 minutes. Also available as a Podcast.

Watch the Developer News of Sept. 25
26 To be released Sept. 29
34 To be released Sept. 29
42 Watch the Developer News of Oct. 2
54 To be released Oct. 6
66 To be released Oct. 6
76 Watch the Developer News of Oct. 9
86 To be released Oct. 13
91 To be released Oct. 13
10None (directly) Watch the Developer News of Oct. 16

Good luck!

üò∏

entry.title: Give your Joule Agents ü§ñ the gift of Memory üí≠, with Hana Cloud ‚ú®
entry.content:
When Joule agents can write/read memories in SAP HANA Cloud, they:

  • Remember business facts at scale (supplier habits, contract quirks, SLA exceptions) ‚úÖ

  • Retrieve them fast & accurately with HANA Cloud Vector Engine ‚ö°

  • Keep memories human-readable, sortable, and dead-simple to implement üß©

That means fewer repeated mistakes, smarter suggestions, and agents that actually learn with your business over time.

An example of some memories for an invoice exception agent.
You can make them as detailed or a simple as you want in the agent prompt!

 

 

How it works

  1. A simple ‚ÄúMemories‚Äù table

    Human-readable text + metadata (who/what it‚Äôs about, when learned, importance, TTL, etc.).

    Optional: a vector column for semantic search.

  2. Vector search for recall

    Store an embedding of each memory ‚Üí use approximate nearest neighbor (ANN) to fetch the right facts instantly (‚ÄúWhich supplier often uses expired POs?‚Äù). BM25 or other strategies are available. I love BM25's reliability for same-language and same-topic knowledge meshes.

  3. One tool your agent calls

    Add a tool (below) so your agent can append or update memories whenever it learns something new.

  4. Update the Agent prompt to have it use the memory well!

           Something like:

Before answering, search (memory.search_hana) with a concise query (supplier/invoice/PO terms; limit top_k‚â§8); 
use the results to tailor your response. 
Only write when you learn a new, stable, factual business detail; 
upsert (memory.upsert_hana) instead of inserting duplicates‚Äîtreat as duplicate if normalized context matches or vector similarity ‚â•0.86 and the same entity (supplier/invoice/PO) is involved; 
if duplicate, refresh last_seen_at (and occurrence_count if available). Format memories as one dense sentence in context 
(e.g., YYYY-MM-DD | INV-XXXX | Supplier ABC | PO 4500001123 | 4,980.00 EUR | expired PO used) 
and a brief actionable description; keep context ‚â§220 chars, use present tense. 
Set importance 1‚Äì5 (5 = critical risk) and ttl_days (low importance decays, 0 = never expires). 
Do not store ephemeral chatter or sensitive data; prefer patterns over one-offs. 
If you update or add a memory, mention it briefly to the user; otherwise be concise and never dump full tables unless asked.

 

Add two memory tools (Joule Skills)

"Add Memory" is a simple SQL Write

"Retrieve Memory" is a simple SQL Read, with semantic search (BM25+Embeddings)

 

 

Advanced memory patterns (that HANA makes easy) üöÄ

  • Disappearing memories (decay/TTL): small quirks fade unless they‚Äôre re-observed.

  • Hierarchical memories: supplier-site ‚Üí supplier ‚Üí region ‚Üí global policy.

  • World representations: keep a simple graph of relationships (supplier‚Üîplant, approver‚Üîcost center), or materialize views for fast joins.

  • Learning from mistakes: tag memories with resolution outcome so the agent prefers strategies that worked.

 

Result:

A living, human-readable knowledge fabric your Joule agents can trust.
It's fast, explainable, and always improving. ‚ú®
